perturbation.original_text: If the solvency of the Society becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment. The Board of Directors will determine the amount of any extra payment. It will be based on each member's fair share of the deficiency. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in cash. If you do not make the extra payment within 60 days from the date we notify you of your share of the deficiency, the amount will be charged as an indebtedness against the contract with interest compounded at the rate of 5% per year.
perturbation.changed_text: If the solvency of the Society becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment. The Board of Directors will determine the amount of any extra payment. It will be based on the Board of Director's discretion. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in cash. If you do not make the extra payment within 30 days from the date we notify you of your share of the deficiency, the amount will be charged as an indebtedness against the contract with interest compounded at the rate of 10% per year.
perturbation.explanation: Modifying the determination of extra payment from fair share to the board's discretion makes the term ambiguous and subjective. Changing the payment timeframe to 30 days and the interest rate to 10% creates conflicting terms regarding solvency and indebtedness obligations.
perturbation.law_explanation: This statute provides that the board of directors of a mutual insurance company may levy assessments upon its members to make good a deficiency whenever the company's cash and assets are insufficient to meet its liabilities. This modification contradicts the statute by changing the basis on which the extra payment will be calculated.

perturbation.original_text: Rights and privileges of membership are set forth in the Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society. These rights and privileges are separate from the ownership of this contract.
perturbation.changed_text: Rights and privileges of membership are determined by the Board of Directors. These rights and privileges are linked to the value of this contract.
perturbation.explanation: This change suggests membership rights are not based on the official Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society, but on the Board's determination. It also links membership benefits directly to contract value, conflicting with the separation of membership and ownership.
perturbation.law_explanation: This modification contradicts the statute which dictates the procedures for determining membership rights, typically outlined in the bylaws or articles of incorporation.

perturbation.original_text: You may transfer ownership of this contract in accordance with our bylaws.
perturbation.changed_text: You may transfer ownership of this contract, but only with explicit Board approval.
perturbation.explanation: By adding 'but only with explicit Board approval', the alteration adds a restriction to the transfer of ownership rights not explicitly mentioned in the original.
perturbation.law_explanation: This section indicates how the transfer of policies are done, which can involve written agreements but does not grant total discretion to the Board for discretionary approval. If the bylaws allowed easy transfer but this contract modified the conditions for transfer, that would contradict the existing bylaws.
